moves.1. d4 d5 2. Bf4 Nf6 3. Nf3 Nc6 4. Nbd2 e: Finally someone who  goes for the hard play! The issue is that I never faced this before, and it seems to become very tactical. I regret not to spend time on theory books.
moves.5. dxe5: I win a tempo on his N, but he can win another on my B. Let's see...
moves.5... Nh5 6. e3: I lose my strong lsb, but I create a center that, I hope, won't be easy to undermine.
moves.6... f6: As soon as move 6 I had the Caissa's devil inside of me. I was insane by playing the most unexpected move I could find.
moves.7. Ng5: Of course, if fxN, QxN+. Nevertheless, he can save the piece by grabbing my lsb.
moves.7... Nxf4 8. exf6: Now he has to choose: either try to save the N by Ng6, but in this case, f7+ would be very unpleasant for him, or to grab the pawn, and accept a piece exchange. He can take f6 with the Q, and this would probably be the best. If 8...Qxf6, 9. exNf4, Qxf4, 10. Qe2+, followed by Ne6, can provide - maybe - some compensation. But he went for
moves.8... gxf6 9. exf4: ...and I officially sacced a full piece. But my Q's diagonal is wide open.
moves.9... fxg5 10. Qh5+ Kd7: I'd say a good compensation for the piece. Now, I had two plans in mind: g3, in order to play Bh3+, but he can defend, probably with Nd4, so to block the check with Ne6. But I can't resist a good attacking castling...
moves.11. O-O-O: ...with all sort of threats, including Ne4, of course. Qf7+ looks tempting, but after Ne7 blocking maybe his pieces can start to move, and I lose my sprint.
moves.11... gxf4: ?? This was a fatal mistake! Sometime, +1700 do those things... Qxd5+, Bd6 is not the best.
moves.12. Ne4 Qe7: ?? Qe8 or Ne7 would have been better. d4 was an option, but after Bb5 my attack goes on.
moves.13. Rxd5+: Probably he realized now that Ke6 is not possible due to Qf5#.
moves.13... Qd6 14. Nf6+: His Q is mine, so I can go on attacking and bringing my pieces closer to his monarch.
moves.14... Ke7: I wanted to play a more aggressive move, but I couldn' find it. So...
moves.15. Rxd6 cxd6 16. Nd5+: The best square for the K was d8, but black is busted anyway.
moves.16... Ke6: Now I think I missed 17. Qe8+, and if KxN, 18. c4+ and it is probably mate in few, but...
moves.17. Nc7+: PRobably better was Bc4, threatening Nb6+...
moves.17... Kd7 18. Nxa8 b6: Qf5+, and if Kd8, Qf6+ wins the other Rook. And if Ke8 or Ke7, QxBc8 wins.
moves.19. Bb5 Bb7 20. Qf5+ Ke7 21. Re1+: ...but being able to bring the other R into the game was very tempting.
moves.21... Ne5 22. Qd7+: ...and a good pin is always impressive...
moves.22... Kf6: NOw Qd8+ looks great. He can't shield with his B since Rh8 is hanging.
moves.24... Re8: The final blunder... 12 rating points won, and with a lot of fun! Thanks for reading.
